creator: ktdreyer@ktdreyer.com
text:
This bug concerns the parsing of server side includes using mod_include. In the
following code:

<!--#echo encoding="none" var="myvar"-->

the encoding="none" attribute works correctly, but when the attributes are
shuffled, such as 

<!--#echo var="myvar" encoding="none"-->

the encoding attribute appears to have no effect.

http://www.sitepoint.com/forums/showthread.php?t=409045 is where I first
discovered this.

I am using Apache 2.0.52 on CentOS 4.3, Linux kernel 2.6.9-34.0.1.EL.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
This also waits to be discovered in the official documentation :-)
<http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_include.html#element.echo>.

Actually there's a sense behind this feature:

<!--#echo encoding="none" var="blah" encoding="url" var="blub" -->

creator: ktdreyer@ktdreyer.com
text:
Whoops, sorry for not reading closely enough - "The encoding attribute must
precede the corresponding var attribute to be effective" Thanks André :)
